description: On May 21, Fiji's Ministry of Health and Medical Services responds to an article written by The Fiji Times to address inaccuracies reported by the article regarding the government's response to COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 20, the Fijian government announced changes to Term 1 school holidays schedule. "The first term school holidays were initially scheduled from 20 April 2020 to 1 May 2020." "The National Term 1 school holidays will now begin on Monday 23 March 2020 and last until 3 April 2020."
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Fiji will be under a nationwide curfew from 10pm to 5am daily from Monday, 30.03.2020. This policy ended on June 21. UPDATE: The original policy set curfew for 10PM - 5AM. This policy has been relaxed and a new curfew has been set for 11PM - 4AM.
Fiji announces a lockdown to the region of suva, starting on 03.04.2020. This policy ended on April 17. UPDATE: The original lockdown policy has ended on March 17.

Fiji refuses the entry to their country to foreign people who have been to Spain, Italy, Irna, South Korea or China the last 14 days. UPDATE: The entry restrictions have been extended. Spain is now included on the list on 18.03.2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Fiji is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers arriving from or having visited China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, Europe, UK and USA. UPDATE: The travel ban has been extended to people from Europe (+ UK) an USA.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)

description: On April 1, the Fijian government announced they will be extending the lockdown in Lautoka to April 7. UPDATE: The original policy did not provide an end date; however, recent news updates mentions that the policy will be extended to April 7.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On April 3, Fiji government imposed lockdown measures on the capital city of Suva. On April 17, the Fiji government lifted lockdown measures. UPDATE: The original policy did not have an end date. It was then announced that the lockdown measure will be extended until April 17.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Fiji bans any social gathering. UPDATE: Any form of social gathering is prohibited in Fiji
FIji allows social gatherings up to 20 people. UPDATE: Social gatherings were competely banned, mow they are allowed with less than 20 People.
